answers.answer: Be careful. Preeclampsia isn't something to mess with and if you're really retaining that much fluid  where you're swelling in minutes you may want to mention that to your ob.
no i meant my feet hurt after 10 minutes of standing, theyre always a little swell though, standing or not. but ill still mention it to him.thank you, what is preclampisa btw?
I'm almost 22 weeks only gained 2 pounds....
I would say around 25-28 weeks I started to really feel the extra weight, its just got worse as time went on. 37+6 and ive gained 34 pounds so far.

My feet swell the worst when I'm at work sitting at my desk! Which super stinks cause I can barely get my flats on by the end of the day lol. I'm 30+3 and gained 16 lbs. With my first I gained a total of 60 2nd gained 45 and 16 so far with 10 weeks to go but I'm guessing ill still gain 35-45 by the end cause I always gain most of my weight the last 4-5 weeks
Preeclampsia is when your blood pressure rises (and stays up) and you have protein in your urine. It's very dangerous for mom and baby. A sign is retaining water and swelling.

question: when did you girls start feeling the extra weight your gaining? and how much have you put on so far during pregnancy? i just turned 26 weeks 3 days ago and i can't even stand on my feet for 10 minutes without my feet starting to hurt and they're also slowly starting to swell.before i got pregnant i weighed 126, now i'm 142
title: feeling the extra weight!
